WRITING.TEXT: Lol I was going to say, the only thing remotely close to Adderall is cocaine. Even EC stack doesn't compare.

I had been prescribed ADD meds on and off in the past. Honestly the appetite suppressant effects only last like 2 weeks for me. You're right, it makes it *easier* to restrict, but hunger does come back. It's up to you if you want to eat or not. Like, once because of Adderall I didn't eat for 3 days and by day 4 I was absolutely ravenous, but I chose not to eat despite being hungry.

Wow you don't have to be rude. A *side effect* of Adderall is decreased appetite. You're not going to feel that side effect forever unless your doctor continues upping your dosage for the rest of your life. Eventually you're going to get your appetite back even while being on Adderall. That's why people are saying "stop eating so much". You can't rely on Adderall forever to help you maintain your weight or lose weight.
Thanks so much for this! I actually bought mira lax today and I will be trying it tomorrow morning if I still don't have a BM.
I always have some on hand! I'll try this at some point. Thanks!!!!
I picked up some Mira Lax today because I've been told it's mild. I'm going to try it tomorrow morning and if it doesn't help then yeah I'm going to get an enema.

Ugh that is really awful. I usually go right after having even half a cup of coffee but I haven't for the past few days. I bought a lax and if that doesn't help I might seriously go to the doctor. Or at least consult my mom who is one.

Sometimes restriction just gets to you and it really does take a toll on your body. Today is my 23rd consecutive day restricting and I sometimes get that feeling you've described - even if I've *just* eaten. I guess it's expected since our bodies aren't getting the fuel they need.
Dieter's tea or something like that right?
Aw thank you so much! Yes I remember and I just have to keep doing what I'm doing and I'll get where I want to be.
I think I might! I guess it's expected that with restriction comes constipation.
Oh that's good to know! Thanks! I was planning on stopping by the pharmacy after class and I'll try to get a saline enema.
I hope you're able to break through your plateau!
LMAO I didn't even put two and two together until now. I'm laughing out loud.
I didn't even think of a fiber supplement. I think that is definitely necessary since I'm finding it difficult to get enough fiber in with my limited caloric intake. Thank you for the suggestion!
Well luckily I have black coffee, black tea and oatmeal at home already! Thank you! I'll definitely try this if nothing from today works.
Ah, I see. I'll try to eat a large quantity of...something. Others are suggesting spinach and that feels safe for me.

I honestly can say I have hardly been drinking any water. I've been meaning to up my water intake but idk why I haven't been doing so! I'll try hydrating even more today. I have a horse show coming up this weekend and it's going to be like 100 degrees so I definitely need to hydrate for that at least. I'll try getting some baby spinach today! I'm extremely iron deficient so I'm sure that'll help with that, too.
Thanks for the suggestions! I've been working to get more fibrous foods in my diet but with my limited caloric intake it can be difficult. I'll look into buying a Fiber One cereal!

Ugh I would totally freak out if I hadn't had a BM in a week and a half! And I thought my 3-4 days was bad! I'm lactose intolerant so I'm thinking of consuming only dairy today to see if that helps because I am kind of scared to take laxatives.
And I do hunter/jumper mostly. I dabble in dressage here and there but I primarily jump. That's so cool you used to break horses! I don't know how you did it. I myself am too scared to get on a green broke horse even - you have some serious balls. I actually started out riding western but switched to English because I found the westenr saddle to be too heavy to put on the horse I had been riding haha. My boy is 18!
And for sure! PM me any time!!!

No I haven't tried that. For me a huge part of my ED is that I need to eat small quantities of food. I planned to eat a chicken breast for dinner tonight but maybe I'll consider adding some veggies to the meal.

I really don't want to take laxatives because I've had a horrible experience with them in the past. But besides dairy, I don't know what my other alternative would be! And today is my only opportunity to take a laxative because the rest of the week, I won't be home much and I um...don't want to have to be using the toilet frequently while I'm out of the house haha.

I really want to fast this week at some point because my weight is still so fucked up despite restricting. TMI but I also haven't really had any BMs so that's making it worse. But anyways, I can't fast at all this week because I have finals and then a horse show this weekend. Ugh. Next week I'm going to go back to fasting 2-3 days a week.

WRITING.TITLE: The scale won't budge and I'm losing my mind.
WRITING.TEXT:
TMI but I STILL have not had a BM since I think Friday? Saturday? I coffee fasted on Sunday to see if that would force a BM and no amount of coffee and cigarettes helped with a BM! Yesterday the scale was down 0.2 pounds which I was so happy to see, but today it's up 0.6 pounds which I know is food and water weight (especially since I haven't had a damn BM).
I'm lactose intolerant and I had half a cup of Halo Top last night and that didn't help at all. I'm seriously thinking of living off cream cheese and the rest of my Halo Top today since I *am* lactose intolerant - that might work in my favor.
I am so fed up! I could scream! Or cry. Or die. Okay not die but ugh.
Any ideas as to what I can do about this? It's so frustrating and truthfully my stomach/belly area is in quite a bit of pain and discomfort. I'm thinking of either coffee fasting again today, living off ice cream and cream cheese today or biting the bullet and buying some laxatives.
Yes they do get pricey! I only bought the small pack to see if I like them. It was like $7 for 4 burger patties! I'll definitely be going to Costco to buy a large pack.

Morningstar Farms garden veggie burger. I texted my friend a few days ago saying I need more fiber in my diet. She sent a picture of a huge ass bag of these veggie burgers she got from Costco, saying they had 3g fiber. So I bought a small pack at the grocery store and they are really tasty! It's got me wanting to make my own veggie burgers.

Yeah! I feel much better this week. Last week was such shit. And yes I've picked foods that have added fiber. The veggie burgers I got have like 3g which is so much better than the absolute lack of fiber I had last week.

WRITING.TITLE: This week is going to be good.
WRITING.TEXT:
So after mostly hating last week's keto trial, I'm back to eating carbs. So far I've had a veggie burger and that alone has made me feel much better. I will also be upping my dosage of Prozac so hopefully my mood improves even further (I'm already feeling happier!). I went food shopping yesterday and bought some good safe foods. I have my macros set on MFP to 40p/30c/30f. I've pre-logged all my food for the week and my macros are pretty spot on! I'm trying to not stress too much about the carb and fat macro, and mainly work to meet my protein goal. I have a horse show this weekend and I bought stuff to make breakfast sandwiches to eat prior to showing with balanced amount of carbs, fat and protein. Each sandwich came out to like, 320 calories which isn't bad at all. I probably won't eat anything on horse show days besides that breakfast sandwich. Maybe a Fiber One bar if I'm feeling too drained. I'm really excited for my show and I'm so relieved to be off keto. Hopefully my weight loss will be linear this week, especially considering how physically active I will be.
I hope you all have a lovely week!

Hey guys! I just started taking the survey and heads up - it can be extremely triggering (in regards to eating disorders, depression, substance abuse, suicidality, dysfunctional/abusive families and sexual assault) and a total damper to your mood. If your mood is low right now or you are feeling emotionally unstable/vulnerable in any way, I would strongly encourage you NOT to take this survey.
The sidebar. Under where it says "link" and "text" it shows your username with "(edit)" next to it. Click that and put in your stats.

Yeah this is me. Counting macros is really stressful for me but I've been an athlete for the last 2 years and I've put on a lot of nice muscle that I don't want to lose. I did keto last week, and while I hated it for the most part, I can visibly see that it helped me lose fat instead of muscle. I have so much more muscle definition in my thighs (though they're still mostly covered with fat). I'm just trying to focus on my protein macro and trying not to stress about the other macros. As long as my intake is mainly protein, I'm okay.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: Whole wheat sandwich slim (90) + Veggie burger patty (110) + 7g butter (50)
Dinner: 4.5 oz chicken breast (124)
Total: 374
I might go to the gym and do some HIIT if I have the energy today.

Height: 5'1"
CW: 112
HW: 158
LW: 87-92 (my mom took my scale away at 92 but I still lost weight, hence the range)
GW: 100
UGW: 85
WL: 22 in total
BMI: 22.1 (new), 21.16 (old)
Age: 22
Gender expression: F
I didn't lose much weight between last week and today. I look and feel thinner but the scale is telling me otherwise. It's really upsetting. Doing keto really fucked shit up for me. Back to eating carbs this week.
The first few days I had horrible liquid poos. But after those few days, it's been so inconsistent and all week my weight has been all over the place despite restricting!

Right now I have them set to 40p/30c/30f. My protein goal is the one I care about hitting the most. I did my food shopping yesterday and pre-logged all my food to MFP and I'm almost spot on most days!
Yeah totally this. I have no problem restricting and I don't have binge tendencies so I guess just doing what I had been doing in the past is what's meant for me!

Oh that must be such an awful feeling. Again, I'm so sorry you had to go through this today! With that said, eating disorders are painful enough as is. I think it's definitely a good idea for you to stay away from movie theaters for a while - you **definitely** don't need that added stress!
Maybe next time you could ask a friend to go to a movie with you? Do you think that would help? Obviously only if they skipped out on movie snacks as well.
I'll look for the simply one! I really wish they made garlic infused spray oils. That would be heavenly.

Maybe consider going slightly higher cal on days you want to work out? Or work out like *right* after you eat something. I feel ya though. I was doing keto last week and the lack of carbs totally killed me during horseback riding. Like, I honestly felt like telling my trainer we needed to stop because I felt like I was dying...ha.

Ugh babe I'm so sorry to hear this. This is something I expect I'd feel if I went to the movies, so I have been avoiding going, despite having nothing to do all day. South Point has $5 movies every Tuesday and I used to go all the time. I would basically not eat all day, eat some popcorn at the movies, and then not eat the rest of the day. But mentally, I don't feel strong enough to be able to eat that kind of popcorn right now. I really hope you feel better 3

Thanks for the tips! Yeah I was thinking of getting some Pam olive oil spray or butter spray to add a bit more flavor with minimal fat. I'm about to go grocery shopping so I'll definitely add that to my list!
I totally feel you regarding being too tired for the gym. I usually eat 300-600 calories a day. If I eat closer to 300 and am sedentary, I still hardly have any energy to work out. But the days I eat closer to 600 are days I ride, and after riding I have 0 energy to do anything.

You definitely should! There's nothing better than physical activity that doesn't make you feel like you're exercising. I force myself to the gym sometimes but when I can't make it, I don't feel *as* bad about it because I know I tend to burn roughly the same amount of calories in the saddle.
Question: I know you said on my one post that you eat chicken breast like every day. What do you do to season it? Usually I brine it for 15 min before I bake it, then rub in a mixture of salt, pepper, garlic powder, etc in before. But I'm looking to do a bit more with it without adding too many oil/fat calories.
I LOVE cooking. Seriously I have soooo many delicious looking recipes pinned on Pinterest. ONE DAY I will cook those meals for others or myself even! And I love kids, too. My barn kids are the best.

Hopefully the dressing on the side thing works out for you! And I know how you feel about wanting to stay home. Hopefully the date takes your mind off things. I find that, even if I do have to eat socially, the social activity itself helps prevent me from over-stressing about food.
I used to ride Western! When I first started riding, I rode western for like 6 months. I switched to English because the western saddle was too heavy for me to put on the horse I was riding (he was tall) haha.
Haha yeah I told her "Well I didn't know I was coming here until the last minute, so I accidentally ate before I came." She seemed content with that answer and carried on eating her wrap.

I'm sorry to hear that :( maybe when the waiter takes your order, ask what's in the dressing. Even if you think it's too fatty/calorific, just say "okay can I have the dressing on the side?" That way it doesn't look like you're avoiding the dressing for nutrition/calorie purposes, rather you're just skeptical of whether or not you'll like it.

I really *did* want to eat at one point because there's this little girl there, she's like 10 years old, who is like a little sister to me, and she kept saying "Aren't you hungry?" and "Why aren't you eating?". I felt bad because I really don't want my lack of eating to project on to her. But anyways, almost everyone commented on my weight loss and it was really triggering so it made me not want to eat even more than I already didn't want to eat - if that makes sense.

Ohhh I see. Hmm. If you're really worried about him thinking you have an ED based on the small plate you get, then maybe get a slightly less healthy small plate? Or you could just get the tuna and say you're doing keto/low carb?

I've cancelled like 3 dinner dates because I've been scared of eating, so I totally feel you. Chicken Paillard is really just grilled or pan seared thin chicken breast, and the sides it comes with look relatively healthy. That's would I would get if I were you.

Yeah I've realized in the last few weeks just *how bad* my eating disorder has gotten. Like, in the past, if someone invited me out to eat, I would go out, eat what I wanted and just go back to restricting the next day and continue until something else came up. I was happier back then, more social *and* I still lost weight. Isolating myself due to food has made me so depressed that my psychiatrist even put me back on Prozac.
However, today I did something really good! My old barn was having a Mother's Day lunch and I actually went! Originally I wasn't going to go, because food, but I bit the bullet and went because I knew that if I didn't go, I'd spend yet another day home, alone and sad. I didn't actually eat at the lunch but I mean, actually going out is a huge breakthrough for me.

I have been thinking of getting Lean Cuisines since they're all under 400 cal and make that possibly the only thing I eat all day. But I fear that the sodium content is really high in most of them. I'm going to look for some with relatively low sodium and keep a few in my freezer. I think having a few of them every week will help my body adjust to going back to eating normal meals if an opportunity comes up for lunch/dinner with friends. Lately with my relapse, I've been avoiding going out with my friends because, well, I have an eating disorder. But I at least want to start doing that, even if I restrict the rest of the week, because isolating myself has made everything soooo much worse.

Thank you for the suggestion! I actually have some flax at home I used to give my horse lol. But I think for now, keto isn't the best option for me. I might revisit it in the future but I definitely need carbs this week to help with riding.
Oh! That looks good! I'll look into. I've been thinking of just baking a chicken breast every night for dinner. And yes I was looking at getting Fage - the fat free one. I love Greek yog so much.
No poops today still :(

Oh yes! I'm definitely going to keep working on my protein goal. Being an athlete, it's important to have the protein for my muscles to recover. I typically eat 300-600 calories a day so I could probably get in 40-60g per day.
LMAOOOOOOO I laughed out loud. Yes that was me thank you for the blessings.

WRITING.TITLE: If it ain't broke don't fix it.
WRITING.TEXT:
So I tried keto this week and it was nice at first, but now I can't stand it. I haven't had enough fibre in my diet, meaning very few BM's, *meaning* major weight fluctuations. Seriously, I can't stand this. I was doing much better when I was still eating carbs (and I mean, super carby carbs like bagels) while restricting and my weight loss was linear, despite a few plateaus. But plateaus are better than my weight skyrocketing up 1.2 pounds overnight!
Anyways, I'm just going to go back to eating carbs, doing what I was doing at the start of my relapse. Also, the lack of carbs is really fucking with my horse riding. Horse riding is difficult enough while restricting but I feel like, as an athlete, I need carbs to perform well. Plus, I'll be able to restrict lower now that I won't be focusing so heavily on fats. I'm also going to stop counting macros, which will be hard, because it's so easy to check macros on MFP and I know I'll stress about it if they aren't close to being right. Anyways, just needed to get that out there. I love you all so much.
Oh! Thank you for the suggestions! I don't have any tums at home but I do have a TJ nearby. I might pick up some tums and some of that cold brew you mentioned.

WRITING.TITLE: Coffee fasting today, unfortunately.
WRITING.TEXT:
I really don't like coffee fasting anymore because coffee is so acidic and lately I've become really sensitive to acids. I ended up having 605 calories instead of 415 because I had some tequila. But this morning my weight was 1.2 pounds higher than yesterday! I'm trying not to take this too seriously since I've basically had no BM's in the last 2 days. But I'm going to coffee fast anyways to see if that helps at all.
Hope you all had a great weekend!
Ah I see. I was going to suggest a veggie/chicken/turkey burger or something for them to throw on the grill since you said BBQ but looks like you've got it all covered!

Alcohol dehydrates you which is why you might weigh less the morning after drinking. But the next day your weight will absolutely be higher since you're no longer dehydrated. But seriously, count calories from alcohol! A glass of wine has more calories than my average breakfast.

No problem! And don't forget, you are male and it's said that men don't stop growing until 25 sometimes. I'm a woman so I'd say 19 was a fair age for me to physically mature. You still have a few years left until your body is probably totally mature!

Any idea what I can do to stop feeling like the biggest pile of shit that ever existed?
Break up with him.
You have an ED and you don't need any more negativity in your life when having an ED makes you hard on yourself anyways. I mean, talk to him about how you feel before you make the decision to break up, but based on your post, he sounds abusive imo. Tell him what you told us.

It's different for everyone. I had a chubby face until I was 19 years old - despite whatever my weight was. When I was 14 years old and first diagnosed with anorexia my BMI was around 16 but I still had a relatively chubby face, because I was young I guess. Right now my BMI is 21. My BMI was 25 (my face wasn't chubby at 25, it was just like, normal?) at the start of my relapse and only recently has my face started to look sunken. I think a lot of how your face looks depends on how nourished you are, *not* always necessarily what your BMI is.
Do you not eat fish or is fish something you don't like/is unsafe?

Pre-plan how much of the bread you'll allow yourself to eat. Like a few pieces every day at a specific time, as long as it fits your calorie goals, until the bread is gone. Make a planned schedule of things to do in between your bread eating time to distract you from wanting more bread. Things that'll help make time go by quickly, so that you can be like "oh wow it's already bread time!"

Breakfast: 3 egg whites (51) + 8g coconut oil (69) + 2 strips bacon (60)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner (planned): 4.5 oz chicken (135) + 14g butter (100)
Exercise: Horse riding lesson (322)
Total: 415-317 = **93 net calories**

WRITING.TITLE: This is grueling.
WRITING.TEXT: So on Monday I was 112.6 and I was stuck at that weight for three days. Then somehow, despite restricting, my weight skyrocketed to 113.8 on Thursday. Then yesterday it went back down to 112.6. And today it's 112.2. What the fuuuuuck. I am *so* close to my lowest adult weight of 111 but so far. I feel like it's a sign from the universe to stop restricting and get my shit together. But I can't stop. Like the idea of being "normal" with my eating is so foreign to me. It's been 20 days since I've eaten any non-safe foods. I can't even imagine eating normal quantities of food, or even upping my intake to like, 800 calories a day. I think I'm going to do a protein shake fast tomorrow worth ~300 calories to see if that helps at all. I really wanted to be 111 point something by Monday. Gah.

It does not help you lose more weight (although there is a small flush of water weight you lose in the beginning). You still have to count calories and you'll still lose the same amount of weight if you restrict to 500 calories on keto or 500 calories on non-keto.
The biggest benefit of keto is that the combination of fat + protein keeps you extremely satiated for several hours. Sometimes after I have a breakfast of eggs + coconut oil, I'm not hungry for like 5 hours. And also, you won't feel bloated after eating keto like you would if you were to eat carbs.
It's worth it for some people. On Sunday I started a 1 week trial of keto and it's nice, up until I have to do physical activity. I'm an athlete and I feel absolutely sick to my stomach during keto. I have been told this feeling will pass, but I don't know if I'm going to keep up with keto.
Good job! So proud of you babe 3

I feel similarly, honestly. Like, I could keep restricting forever. I get cravings but they pass. I really dread anything that would prevent me from restricting. I have a date with this cool guy on Sunday, maybe, and I mean, I'm looking forward to seeing him but I don't want to eat lol. I just like to see how long I can go with continuous restricting. Today was day 19 of continuous restricting and I want to keep going.

Omg! Honestly!? I made a post last weekend about smashing my scale and the post was at like 25%. Your post is about scales and it's at 50%. Someone seriously does not like the idea of us getting rid of scales!
Anyways, I am SO proud of you. I know how aggravating the scale can be. I would ideally like to only weigh myself once or twice a week. I think after I hit my first GW (which is 110, so not too far off) I'm going to start weighing in just twice a week.
You're right, the fluctuations are too much to handle. I hate that I check my weight later at night even though I already KNOW my weight is going to be higher than it was when I first woke up, because food and water weight.
I totally feel you on the measurements thing. A lot of my measurements are getting smaller but the scale either doesn't budge or my rate of loss is sooo slow.
3 hang in there! Don't fish it out tomorrow morning! You just have tow wait until Monday!

/r/progresspics
Just blur out your face if you want it to be anonymous.

The only time starvation mode actually happens, if I recall correctly, is if a woman is at like ~5% body fat which is *typically* less body fat than pro female bodybuilders even have. It's such a load of bull. Oh, and then she told me. "You know, I went into starvation mode once. I worked all day and didn't have time to eat. I'd come home and have dinner and I gained *so* much weight." Ok no honey you just had a huge fucking dinner that was well above your TDEE. You don't go into starvation mode within 16 hours lmao

**"Literally just eat."**
My best friend said that to me when I told her about my recent relapse. It's so fucking dumb. It's like telling a heroin addict to "literally just stop doing heroin."
**"Your body goes into starvation mode and as soon as you start eating again, you'll gain all the weight back."**
Again, something my best friend said to me. Do people seriously think that "you'll gain all the weight back" is going to make someone STOP starving themselves? I know starvation mode is a myth, but if I didn't know it was a myth, I would end up believing her and purposely *not* stop starving myself out of fear that I'll gain "everything" back if I *do* eat.
OMG same. I text people PARAGRAPHS and the next morning I feel so embarrassed.

Yo, same. I still have a few pills left from an Adderall prescription I had last year and as much as I'd love to take them to decrease my appetite, I hate the side effects. Sweating, heart palpitations, good but freaking weird moods...not fun. I don't like *not* being myself.

I was prescribed it briefly as a trial for my ADHD. I lost a lot of weight on it - the first week I lost 7 pounds. It really decreases your appetite. It's an amphetamine and pretty much any amphetamine will decrease your appetite - for a while. After a few months your appetite will go back to normal unless your dosage changes.

You can freeze a lot of things raw. Besides the celery, leek and cabbage, I think you can freeze the rest of the veggies (chop the onions before you freeze them). Grapes and pineapples can be frozen as well, but I'm not sure how the oranges, apples and mangoes will fare in the freezer.

Yeah. I hit 112.6 today and, while I'm nowhere near underweight, I've been losing a lot around my knees and lower thighs. I hate wearing pants when I sleep so it really hurts. I'll probably end up sleeping with a pillow between my knees.

I love the yolk, too! I was skeptical about eating just the whites because I felt like it would be *so* bland. But adding spices and herbs to it makes it really tasty. I usually add salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and dried parsley to the egg whites and mix it before pouring it in the pan. If you're willing to add a few extra calories for butter or coconut oil, it makes it even tastier and the combination of fat + protein keeps you full longer.

Keto Day 6
Breakfast: 1 whole egg (70) + 2 egg whites (34) + 10g coconut oil (86)
Lunch: Nothing
Dinner (planned): 3.5 oz chicken (105) + 14g butter (100)
Total: 395

Ah well I'm doing keto now, eating 300 to 500 calories a day, so I've been eating the yolks on occasion for added fat. But in the past, I would just separate the eggs and toss the yolks. I know at the grocery store they have cartons of just egg whites so you can buy that so you're not wasting any yolks!
[This is what I'm referring to](https://www.google.com/search?q=egg+white+beaters client=safari rls=en source=lnms tbm=isch sa=X ved=0ahUKEwjnuvHe58XMAhWCKyYKHSzcAdYQ_AUICCgC biw=1280 bih=662#imgrc=yedxZ4sJ83_B9M%3A).

I've found it helpful to give myself permission to binge once every few weeks.
I used to do this as well. Back in 2013 when I relapsed, I'd fast every Monday, restrict the rest of the week, and on Saturday or Sunday I'd allow myself to eat almost anything. I remember one "binge day" it was half a dozen Krispy Kreme doughnuts. Another day it was like 3 tacos and a burrito from Taco Bell. It kept me sane, it gave me the chance to eat whatever I had been craving all week, and I still lost weight. Another time I went to an Indian buffet and took the buffet to go. I filled the container with whatever I wanted and ate it between like noon and 7pm. That was probably the best type of thing for me to do because I ate until I was satisfied then kept eating every few hours. I never felt uncomfortably full.

I don't really binge per say, as in, I don't eat mass quantities of food in a short period of time until I'm uncomfortably full. But a binge to me is eating any unsafe food or meal. Like, if I go to Taco Bell and get a burrito and two mini quesadillas, that's a binge to me, even though the total calories is at/under maintenance. Or, if I go to a restaurant and have some of the bread, most of my entree and a dessert. I mean, I might feel uncomfortable after a restaurant meal, but it's not as though I lost control at the restaurant. I guess anything that's not restricting is a binge (to me).
Egg whites! 4 egg whites is 69 calories and they are sooo filling. Low sodium broth and soups are great, too. Frozen veggies are usually like 60 cal per cup, depending on what veggies you get.
The weather is actually crap today so we cancelled since it was an outdoor mall we were planning on going to. Ha...

WRITING.TITLE: Lunch with a friend.
WRITING.TEXT:
So my best friend (who also has/had/is recovered from anorexia) and I have tentative plans to meet up for lunch and shopping tomorrow since I have an appointment at the Apple Store. I am kind of freaking out. Firstly, she is really thin so she's kinda triggering-ish in a way. Secondly, since she is so thin and beautiful, the idea of eating in front of her is terrifying to me. I picked an entree at a restaurant we might go to. If I ate half the entree, it would be 540 calories. Not bad! But I'm still scared. Scared of eating at a restaurant, scared of eating an unsafe food, even if it's the only thing I'll eat all day and be 540 calories, and scared of eating in front of my friend.
I feel like I'm out of excuses with her and, having had an ED, I feel like she can see right through my excuses. She and I got our nails done together yesterday and later that day I was texting her regarding me freaking out about having to nourish myself if I horse show. She replied saying it's obvious I had lost a lot of weight in the last 2 weeks alone. So I don't know.
Part of me feels like being honest with her and saying "You know I'm really struggling and the idea of eating at a restaurant and it's really troubling me, do you think we could skip the lunch part and maybe just do drinks and shopping instead of a meal?" BUT I'm afraid that might trigger *her*.
Really, I'm just ranting. But any advice is welcome. Love you guys 3
Haha! Don't worry about it.

Oh okay when you said Flamingo LVAC I assumed you meant like 215/Flamingo area. Well, Sandhill and Flamingo is close-ish to campus so I might have to stop by some time if my nearby Smith's doesn't have it!
Did y'all see the one where OP on tumblr said "thin privilege is having anorexia". Like wow.
My local Von's doesn't have the birthday cake flavor :/ I'm going to try Smith's next week when I go food shopping. What's the price point between Von's and Whole Foods? Is it more expensive at WF?

Sorry I'm late! Ha. Keto day 5...
Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: 2 strips bacon (60) + 12g coconut oil (103) + 2 egg whites (34) + 1 whole egg (70)
Dinner: Nothing
Exercise: Horse riding lesson (487!!!)
Total: 267-487 = -220 net calories!!!!!
Holy shit I just had one of the most intense lessons of my life! My trainer pushed me so hard, she totally kicked my ass. Like, at one point I was convinced she was angry/punishing me for something because she made me work that hard.
I started Prozac today and it's kind of abolished my appetite. I ate at 12:30 and had my lesson from 3:30 to 4:30. It's almost 6:30 now and I'm still not hungry. Gah. I really really wanted to hit 500 calories consumed today but the Prozac! My mood is slightly better but this is kind of counterproductive lmao. But maybe it's not the Prozac because doesn't it take ~2 weeks to really "work"?
Thanks the goal! Thank you for your support 3
Ugh! Exactly. I feel like crap when they place better than me haha. But you're right, it is worth it. I miss showing *so* much.
